subject: Plus X pedal issue
description_text:
Good Day and Hello,

  We purchased, on Oct 19th, the 3 pedal Plus X set up, including base
plate with the Rector VAM Haptics to replace our Thrust Master pedals
on our PC based simulator through Amazon. At the same time we upgraded to a
Fanatec CSL DD wheel and hub which work perfectly.
We love the look and feel of the Plus X but we cannot get the throttle to
connect to any game we have. (LeMans, Kart Sim, etc)
We have downloaded 2.1.2 software and use the management system to
calibrate and everything works correctly there. We can make adjustments to
all three pedals and activate the VAM no problem. But when we run any game,
it will not recognize the throttle. Because it works on the management page
we believe the problem is in the software connection to a game....something
is missing in the set up.
At first, we were getting the message on the bottom left of the management
screen, "Not connected to telemetry", but we worked through that, now it
says connected. We have tried every setting on the games too in order to
get the pedals to work but under each setting it just says "Blank" and
doesn't recognize the presence of the pedal. We can't calibrate in any
game. (Which was no problem with the ThrustMaster set up.

Things we have also tried,
Making sure the ground wire is attached to clean bare metal between the
control box and the sim frame.
Unplugging and replugging every connection
Trying different UBS ports on the PC
Restarting the PC, the Simsonn app and each of the games after every
adjustment

Should we download any other version of your software? Or is there a driver
that we need to load?

Considering that it all worked with the Thrust Master we don't believe it
to be a hardware issue.

Please let us know what your suggestions are as soon as possible. We are
eager to get our system up and running.
(We are car racers who use the sim everyday for practice or to become
familiar with a new track we're about to visit)

Also, on another note, the power plug for the control box seems to have too
large of a hole in the middle for the connection in the box. The plug
barely attaches to the box and easily falls out. It seems like the wrong
plug on the wire, 3.5 mm and the pin in the box is 2mm. Please let me know
your thoughts on this too.

Thank You,

Doug Bolt
dbolt2325@gmail.com
Orlando, FL USA

conversations.body_text: Hi Doug Bolt,  Please test the throttle signal in SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 and check whether the blue signal moves from 0% to 100%. You can click the Offset button to shift the white initial signal to 0%, then recalibrate the pedal. Once the blue signal responds correctly from 0% to 100%, proceed to your in-game settings. If the issue persists, please record a short video and send it to us via Google Drive, making sure the sharing permission is enabled.
Hi Doug Bolt,  Did you reply with an email address?
We have to try their recommendations tomorrow.
